fields.name: free
fields.description: Free capacity

fields.name: used
fields.description: Used capacity

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total capacity

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: kilobytes
fields.description: Capacity in kilobytes

fields.name: disks
fields.description: Capacity in number of disks

fields.name: idx
fields.description: Array slot number. Parity1 is always 0 and Parity2 is always 29. Array slots will be 1 - 28. Cache slots are 30 - 53. Flash is 54.

fields.name: size
fields.description: (KB) Disk Size total

fields.name: rotational
fields.description: Is the disk a HDD or SSD.

fields.name: temp
fields.description: Disk temp - will be NaN if array is not started or DISK_NP

fields.name: numReads
fields.description: Count of I/O read requests sent to the device I/O drivers. These statistics may be cleared at any time.

fields.name: numWrites
fields.description: Count of I/O writes requests sent to the device I/O drivers. These statistics may be cleared at any time.

fields.name: numErrors
fields.description: Number of unrecoverable errors reported by the device I/O drivers. Missing data due to unrecoverable array read errors is filled in on-the-fly using parity reconstruct (and we attempt to write this data back to the sector(s) which failed). Any unrecoverable write error results in disabling the disk.

fields.name: fsSize
fields.description: (KB) Total Size of the FS (Not present on Parity type drive)

fields.name: fsFree
fields.description: (KB) Free Size on the FS (Not present on Parity type drive)

fields.name: fsUsed
fields.description: (KB) Used Size on the FS (Not present on Parity type drive)

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of Disk - used to differentiate Cache / Flash / Array / Parity

fields.name: warning
fields.description: (%) Disk space left to warn

fields.name: critical
fields.description: (%) Disk space left for critical

fields.name: fsType
fields.description: File system type for the disk

fields.name: comment
fields.description: User comment on disk

fields.name: format
fields.description: File format (ex MBR: 4KiB-aligned)

fields.name: transport
fields.description: ata | nvme | usb | (others)

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: BigInt
types.description: The `BigInt` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.description: Current array state

fields.description: Current array capacity

fields.name: boot
fields.description: Current boot disk

fields.name: parities
fields.description: Parity disks in the current array

fields.name: disks
fields.description: Data disks in the current array

fields.name: caches
fields.description: Caches in the current array

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name

fields.description: (KB) Total size

fields.name: exclude
fields.description: Disks that are excluded from this share

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: device

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of disk (e.g. SSD, HDD)

fields.name: totalCylinders

fields.name: totalHeads

fields.name: totalSectors

fields.name: totalTracks

fields.name: tracksPerCylinder

fields.name: sectorsPerTrack

fields.name: firmwareRevision

fields.name: smartStatus

fields.name: temperature

fields.name: partitions
fields.description: The partitions on the disk

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.description: The text color of the header

fields.name: headerSecondaryTextColor
fields.description: The secondary text color of the header

types.description: The theme name

fields.description: How many docker containers are running

types.description: Temperature unit (Celsius or Fahrenheit)

fields.name: apps
fields.description: Count of docker containers

fields.description: Total size of all the files in the container

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status message indicating the outcome of the backup initiation.

fields.name: jobId
fields.description: Job ID if available, can be used to check job status.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the log file

fields.name: path
fields.description: Full path to the log file

fields.name: size
fields.description: Size of the log file in bytes

fields.name: modifiedAt
fields.description: Last modified timestamp

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path to the log file

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content of the log file

fields.name: totalLines
fields.description: Total number of lines in the file

fields.name: startLine
fields.description: Starting line number of the content (1-indexed)

fields.name: dataSchema
fields.description: The data schema for the settings

fields.name: uiSchema
fields.description: The UI schema for the settings

fields.name: values
fields.description: The current values of the settings

fields.name: restartRequired
fields.description: Whether a restart is required for the changes to take effect

fields.name: values
fields.description: The updated settings values

fields.name: unified
fields.description: A view of all settings

fields.name: api
fields.description: The API setting values

fields.name: chargeLevel
fields.description: Battery charge level as a percentage (0-100). Unit: percent (%). Example: 100 means battery is fully charged

fields.name: estimatedRuntime
fields.description: Estimated runtime remaining on battery power. Unit: seconds. Example: 3600 means 1 hour of runtime remaining

fields.name: health
fields.description: Battery health status. Possible values: 'Good', 'Replace', 'Unknown'. Indicates if the battery needs replacement

fields.name: inputVoltage
fields.description: Input voltage from the wall outlet/mains power. Unit: volts (V). Example: 120.5 for typical US household voltage

fields.name: outputVoltage
fields.description: Output voltage being delivered to connected devices. Unit: volts (V). Example: 120.5 - should match input voltage when on mains power

fields.name: loadPercentage
fields.description: Current load on the UPS as a percentage of its capacity. Unit: percent (%). Example: 25 means UPS is loaded at 25% of its maximum capacity

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the UPS device. Usually based on the model name or a generated ID

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name for the UPS device. Can be customized by the user

fields.name: model
fields.description: UPS model name/number. Example: 'APC Back-UPS Pro 1500'

fields.name: status
fields.description: Current operational status of the UPS. Common values: 'Online', 'On Battery', 'Low Battery', 'Replace Battery', 'Overload', 'Offline'. 'Online' means running on mains power, 'On Battery' means running on battery backup

fields.name: battery
fields.description: Battery-related information

fields.name: power
fields.description: Power-related information

fields.name: service
fields.description: UPS service state. Values: 'enable' or 'disable'. Controls whether the UPS monitoring service is running

fields.name: upsCable
fields.description: Type of cable connecting the UPS to the server. Common values: 'usb', 'smart', 'ether', 'custom'. Determines communication protocol

fields.name: customUpsCable
fields.description: Custom cable configuration string. Only used when upsCable is set to 'custom'. Format depends on specific UPS model

fields.name: upsType
fields.description: UPS communication type. Common values: 'usb', 'net', 'snmp', 'dumb', 'pcnet', 'modbus'. Defines how the server communicates with the UPS

fields.name: device
fields.description: Device path or network address for UPS connection. Examples: '/dev/ttyUSB0' for USB, '192.168.1.100:3551' for network. Depends on upsType setting

fields.name: overrideUpsCapacity
fields.description: Override UPS capacity for runtime calculations. Unit: volt-amperes (VA). Example: 1500 for a 1500VA UPS. Leave unset to use UPS-reported capacity

fields.name: batteryLevel
fields.description: Battery level threshold for shutdown. Unit: percent (%). Example: 10 means shutdown when battery reaches 10%. System will shutdown when battery drops to this level

fields.name: minutes
fields.description: Runtime threshold for shutdown. Unit: minutes. Example: 5 means shutdown when 5 minutes runtime remaining. System will shutdown when estimated runtime drops below this

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Timeout for UPS communications. Unit: seconds. Example: 0 means no timeout. Time to wait for UPS response before considering it offline

fields.name: killUps
fields.description: Kill UPS power after shutdown. Values: 'yes' or 'no'. If 'yes', tells UPS to cut power after system shutdown. Useful for ensuring complete power cycle

fields.name: nisIp
fields.description: Network Information Server (NIS) IP address. Default: '0.0.0.0' (listen on all interfaces). IP address for apcupsd network information server

fields.name: netServer
fields.description: Network server mode. Values: 'on' or 'off'. Enable to allow network clients to monitor this UPS

fields.name: upsName
fields.description: UPS name for network monitoring. Used to identify this UPS on the network. Example: 'SERVER_UPS'

fields.name: modelName
fields.description: Override UPS model name. Used for display purposes. Leave unset to use UPS-reported model

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the vm (uuid)

fields.name: name
fields.description: A friendly name for the vm

fields.name: state
fields.description: Current domain vm state

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: The UUID of the vm

inputFields.name: remoteName
inputFields.description: The name of the remote configuration to use for the backup.

inputFields.name: sourcePath
inputFields.description: Source path to backup (typically the flash drive).

inputFields.name: destinationPath
inputFields.description: Destination path on the remote.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description: Additional options for the backup operation, such as --dry-run or --transfers.

inputFields.name: service
inputFields.description: Enable or disable the UPS monitoring service

inputFields.name: upsCable
inputFields.description: Type of cable connecting the UPS to the server

inputFields.name: customUpsCable
inputFields.description: Custom cable configuration (only used when upsCable is CUSTOM). Format depends on specific UPS model

inputFields.name: upsType
inputFields.description: UPS communication protocol

inputFields.name: device
inputFields.description: Device path or network address for UPS connection. Examples: '/dev/ttyUSB0' for USB, '192.168.1.100:3551' for network

inputFields.name: overrideUpsCapacity
inputFields.description: Override UPS capacity for runtime calculations. Unit: watts (W). Leave unset to use UPS-reported capacity

inputFields.name: batteryLevel
inputFields.description: Battery level percentage to initiate shutdown. Unit: percent (%) - Valid range: 0-100

inputFields.name: minutes
inputFields.description: Runtime left in minutes to initiate shutdown. Unit: minutes

inputFields.name: timeout
inputFields.description: Time on battery before shutdown. Unit: seconds. Set to 0 to disable timeout-based shutdown

inputFields.name: killUps
inputFields.description: Turn off UPS power after system shutdown. Useful for ensuring complete power cycle

types.name: UPSServiceState
types.description: Service state for UPS daemon

types.name: UPSCableType
types.description: UPS cable connection types

types.name: UPSType
types.description: UPS communication protocols

types.name: UPSKillPower
types.description: Kill UPS power after shutdown option

inputFields.name: names
inputFields.description: Array of plugin package names to add or remove

inputFields.name: bundled
inputFields.description: Whether to treat plugins as bundled plugins. Bundled plugins are installed to node_modules at build time and controlled via config only.

inputFields.name: restart
inputFields.description: Whether to restart the API after the operation. When false, a restart has already been queued.

inputFields.name: accessType
inputFields.description: The type of WAN access to use for Remote Access

inputFields.name: forwardType
inputFields.description: The type of port forwarding to use for Remote Access

inputFields.name: port
inputFields.description: The port to use for Remote Access. Not required for UPNP forwardType. Required for STATIC forwardType. Ignored if accessType is DISABLED or forwardType is UPNP.

inputFields.name: apiKey
inputFields.description: The API key for authentication

inputFields.name: userInfo
inputFields.description: User information for the sign-in

inputFields.name: preferred_username
inputFields.description: The preferred username of the user

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The email address of the user

inputFields.name: avatar
inputFields.description: The avatar URL of the user

inputFields.name: accessType
inputFields.description: The type of WAN access to use for Remote Access

inputFields.name: forwardType
inputFields.description: The type of port forwarding to use for Remote Access

inputFields.name: port
inputFields.description: The port to use for Remote Access. Not required for UPNP forwardType. Required for STATIC forwardType. Ignored if accessType is DISABLED or forwardType is UPNP.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: The AccessURL Input for dynamic remote access

inputFields.name: enabled
inputFields.description: Whether to enable or disable dynamic remote access

types.name: AuthActionVerb
types.description: Available authentication action verbs

types.name: AuthPossession
types.description: Available authentication possession types

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

directives.name: usePermissions
directives.description: Directive to document required permissions for fields

args.name: action
args.description: The action verb required for access

args.name: possession
args.description: The possession type required for access
